CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property
JUDGES: Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Mihai Poalelungi;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza
TEXT: CARDINAL . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE ORG in GPE awarded a pension to the applicant . It was to be paid to him for a period beginning on DATE .

CARDINAL . Under the applicable provisions of domestic law , ORG was competent to make payments to the applicant , but it failed to do so . In a letter to the ORG dated DATE , the Director of ORG confirmed the applicant ’s entitlement to a military pension .

CARDINAL . As ORG still refused to make payments , apparently considering that the DATE decision was not in conformity with the law , the applicant lodged an action with ORG on DATE , complaining about the ORG ’s failure to pay . In its pleadings , the ORG argued that the decision had been given in breach of substantive provisions of the applicable social insurance laws . It further indicated that it had informed ORG about its doubts as to the lawfulness of the decision . Subsequently , the ORG had summoned the applicant to undergo an additional medical examination . As the applicant had failed to comply with the summons , payment of a part of his pension had been stayed with effect from CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . By a judgment of DATE the court allowed the applicant ’s action . It ordered ORG to pay the amount of pension due for the period from DATE to CARDINAL DATE . It noted the decision staying payment of the applicant ’s pension . However , it stressed that the decision given on DATE had not been appealed against and , as a result , had become final . The ORG was therefore bound by it . There were no grounds for not paying the applicant the amounts due for DATE . The court was not competent to reexamine the lawfulness of the DATE decision in the proceedings before it .
CARDINAL . The Military Pensions Office appealed . It reiterated that , in its view , the DATE decision had not been in compliance with the substantive law .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment , finding that the first - instance court had correctly found that it had not been empowered to re - examine the lawfulness of the DATE decision . It further reiterated that this decision had to be complied with by ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant reiterated his request to have the amounts due paid to him , but to no avail . Subsequently , ORG lodged a cassation appeal against this judgment with ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant complained to ORG and to the Prime Minister about the ORG ’s failure to pay him the pension .
CARDINAL . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE ORG dismissed the appeal lodged by the ORG , finding that it had failed to comply with the relevant procedural requirements .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE ORG paid the applicant the amounts in arrears together with statutory interest .
CARDINAL . Under LAW , as applicable at the material time , judgments of the second - instance courts were immediately enforceable .
